summary: This document is a financial statement from Deutsche Bank detailing the account activity of Jeffrey Epstein for the month of November 2016. It includes transactions such as transfers, checks paid, and service charges, reflecting significant financial movements and balances in Epstein's accounts.

connections.description: Stewart Oldfield is a representative of Deutsche Bank who assists Jeffrey Epstein with his banking needs.
W Chester Brewer Jr. is associated with a transaction involving Epstein's account.
Karyna Shuljak is involved in a transaction where funds were transferred from Epstein's account.
Martin O. Weinberg is an attorney who received payments from Epstein's account.
Tonja Iladdad is associated with a trust account that received funds from Epstein's account.

events.title: Beginning Balance
events.description: The financial statement begins with a balance of $2,651,021.23 as of November 1, 2016.

events.title: Ending Balance
events.description: The ending balance of Epstein's account as of November 30, 2016, is $777,038.97.

events.title: Funds Transfer
events.description: A funds transfer of $300,000.00 was made from Epstein's account.

events.title: Outgoing Money Transfer
events.description: An outgoing money transfer of $350,000.00 was made to Valley National Bank.

events.title: Preauthorized Debit
events.description: A preauthorized debit of $24,846.19 was processed from Epstein's account.

locations: 6100 Red Hook Qtr, B3, Saint Thomas, 00802, United States Virgin Islands
keyFacts: The document is a financial statement from Deutsche Bank detailing Jeffrey Epstein's account activity for November 2016.
The ending balance of Epstein's account as of November 30, 2016, is $777,038.97.
Significant transactions include multiple outgoing money transfers to various accounts, including those of Karyna Shuljak and Martin O. Weinberg.
The statement reflects a series of large debits, including a $300,000 transfer on November 1, 2016.
There are several mentions of preauthorized debits and service charges throughout the statement.
